page.title: 16A University Head of Dept.
page.content: I arrive at 8.55 am to do my work as Head of the History Department. From 9am to 10 am I answer as many letters as I can. At 10 I have a tutorial for an hour with 6 students. At 11 I do some paperwork and perhaps see students about their problems or work. At 12 I lecture about 19th and 20th century Europe in the lecture theatre. At 1 pm I have lunch and perhaps a swim in the university pool. At 2 I have an afternoon tutorial followed by more administrative work. I see more students and around 5.30pm I go home. I do about one hour research a day if I have time. On Fridays I try to do my own research but altogether I have less free time than my colleagues.
